website_summaries.verdict: A great option for those looking for wireless headphones primarily for listening to music.
pros: Connects to all Bluetooth devices with a battery life of 8 hours (12 days on standby time)
Good quality sound, but the fit isn't ideal for using during vigorous exercise
Comes with a 3.5-millimeter cable if you want to use wired
cons: Sound quality could be a bit better
The material used on the headband can catch on hair

customer_reviews.title: No good if you wear glasses
customer_reviews.text: They sounded good and worked well, but I had to return them. I wear glasses, and they were extremely uncomfortable, pinching my glasses hard against the side of my head.
customer_reviews.author: David K

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and design
customer_reviews.text: I've had these headphones for about a year now & they still sound great(especially via Bluetooth). Battery life is still 7-8 hours on a full charge & the range is fairly great as advertised. The only letdown is the quality of the ear pads... The faux leather padding is made from a cheap plastic material that started falling appart after 8months of use. Now I have to buy replacements for my perfectly working headphones. I wish Jabra could make better quality pads for this otherwise great set of BT headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Mangi

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is great, and the battery life is long too at ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these from a recommendation from Wire Cutter. The sound quality is great, and the battery life is long too at eight hours, but they hurt my ears. The cushions are small so they squeeze my ears rather than enveloping them. the band also squeezes my head all the way around, which equals more head squeezing. While they sound great, I can't keep these because I can't stand to use them through the entire work day.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth still sucks.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is surprisingly good, and the the battery life is quite impressive. The material quality is pretty solid, too. But Bluetooth still sucks. Bad. Random disconnects, though it usually immediately reconnects or just beeps at you (both of which are annoying). I use it regularly, and I'm pretty happy with it, but maaan am I hoping good-quality Bluetooth 5 headphones work better (and come out soon). Update: Two months later and the sound just cuts out every few seconds now. Sometimes it will refuse to pair for no reason. This thingis garbage. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon McAlpin

customer_reviews.title: Do not pair well with computers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these just in time to start working from home. At first I was very pleased to not be tethered to my desk, but I began to experience issues with the mic and sound during Zoom meetings. One of the other reviews made mention of issues connecting bluetooth to devices other than phones, but I didn't see any reason why that would be an issue. After further investigation, I found an FAQ on the Jabra site where they explicitly state that they do not recommend connecting directly to a computer, and that they are "optimized to be used with other Bluetooth devices, such as, smartphones or tablets."
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Annoying headphones
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these on sale, for $100 and the sound quality is really good, however it’s trumped by the fact that you’re prompted to charge really early, with almost half a charge the automated voice comes on telling you to charge constantly which interrupts everything I’m listening to. Second, after an hour of listening the ear pieces get very uncomfortable. Lastly when connected to two devices, the headphones inform you that your connected to two devices again interrupting what your listening to until you disconnect the second device. I like the sound quality but the other Bluetooth and charging prompts along with comfort would deter me from buying them again.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Dacruz

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect for the price
customer_reviews.text: There is a robot lady who lives inside the headphones, and she tells you things like, "Connected," or, "Two devices connected." When you disconnect from a paired Bluetooth device, she says, "Disconnected" in this dejected, sad voice. It's like she is severely disappointed in your life decisions.
customer_reviews.author: Safetypants

customer_reviews.title: Broaden your market!l
customer_reviews.text: I would probably give the Jabra earphones a much better review, but as a 74 year old, I find the tiny control buttons too small to use easily. I’ve had friends my age ask to try mine out, but I’ve told them about this problem. I’d suggest that they look for products with buttons that can more easily be distinguished from one another, and more easily seen As we age we still love music, still want portability and ease of use on exercise equipment or while walking, and we still want quality sound. We are a considerable market segment. Please think of us as one. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Mary Therese

customer_reviews.title: My teen hasn't complained or broken them in six months
customer_reviews.text: My teen uses these nonstop while on her laptop or phone at home. She is careful with her things but has put them through more use in six months than I would have in years. She loves how much better they sound compared to earbuds and they are "super cushion-y" on her ears so she doesn't complain about soreness from extended wear. A good value for the quality of sound and the durability. I cant comment on how they would hold up to a backpack or carry on bag environment, but for reliable charging and sound after much home use they seem to be a reliable choice.
customer_reviews.author: LXXV

customer_reviews.title: Fristrating struggle. Earphone only pair with iPhone and not with any other device.
customer_reviews.text: I found that these earphones will only pair readily with an iPhone. They do not pair with iPad or (consistently) with Bluetooth transmitters. These facts are acknowledged by customer support, once you figure out how to contact them, bit this information needs to be prominently featured in product literature and on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: chemist_of_berkeley

customer_reviews.title: Stretched out after a couple months of use
customer_reviews.text: Initially I really loved these headphones for their lightweight construction and great sound quality. Unfortunately I have had the same problem as other reviewers – after a couple months of use the headphones have completely stretched out. I can no longer use them when I'm exercising and I can't even look down without them falling off of my head. I really wanted to love these for much longer than they actually ended up lasting!
customer_reviews.author: Kinger

customer_reviews.title: Never works
customer_reviews.text: OK the sound quality good. Great if you don't want to blast the TV. My objection? It never is charged when you want to use it. The on off switch on the head set. Micro. Never turns off automatically if not in use, or seemingly even when turned off at the end of the program doesn't turn off. Consequently when you want to tune in. You have to recharge. Annoying. We bought two of them, mine warbles or echoes. I thought Jabras were pretty good but a mistake made. Oh and you can control the sound again with a microscopic on off but subtle subtle
customer_reviews.author: Greta

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, just don't bend over.
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound. I am a Jabra fan, having had my Jabra Solemate for nearly 4 years now. For the price, this can't be beaten. So the 4-stars? Well, if you have longer hair, if you bend over, these will slide off. They were fine as I was running, but then I had to bend over and tie my shoe, they promptly slid off my head. Sound, Battery life, look = great. Stay on your head while you are doing chores around the house= ok, too much slippage.
customer_reviews.author: Ringo Miyagi

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price point but a few issues.
customer_reviews.text: I grade this a 4 out 5 overall. The best thing about these headphones by far is how it looks. They are the perfect shape and size, with a simple but sleek design that makes them aesthically pleasing. The sound quality is very good but not great, it can use a tad more volume. The worst part of these headphones is the trouble with the mic. It's almost unusable to accept a phone call which isn't a huge deal for me. The last thing to note is that they are not that comfortable, after about an hour of use, my eyes def start to hurt a bit. With all that said, I am actually very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shocked!
customer_reviews.text: I read about this on several sites and as I saw this on a discount, quickly jumped the gun since its a good deal, but it is not. I was planning to get this to replace my Bluedio TN, but I honestly don't understand why they were praising this headphones. The sounds are okay, you won't get the deep bass much its just clear. I tried this comparing with Bluedio and Apple EarPods to actually check if I'm mistaken but they all had better bass than this. I expected more to be honest.
customer_reviews.author: DotCyril

customer_reviews.title: broke after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my daughter. She loves (loved) them. Until they broke, that is. After just a little over 4 months one of the earpieces broke off of the headband. In looking at it there is a very small attachment point, looks like less than 1/4" square, that holds the earpieces to the headband itself. I guess it was only a matter of time before they broke, looking at the poor design, especially at a stress point like that. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product...
customer_reviews.text: I've been through a lot of blue-tooth devices and a big share of them have been headphones. This by far(leaps and bounds) is one of the better blue-tooth headsets out there. Low profile, great sound, and study build. Connection range is normal and sound is great. I own some high end headphones, of course there is no comparison to a wired headset, but these are just great. Fantastic price point, great cans!! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AdamMH982

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good, feels bad
customer_reviews.text: I picked these up to use mostly at work. I'm a programmer and wear headphones for hours at a time, listening to both podcasts and music. I've used them for about 4 weeks now. I really rather like the look of these, and though I'm not exactly an audiophile, I find the sound to be excellent. The problem is that around the 3-hour mark, these things just hurt like hell. I'm not sure if it's the angle the cups turn to, if my head is/ears are just too big, or something else entirely, but I simply can't bring myself to use them for that long. Maybe on-ear headphones just aren't for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Brombal

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this pair for a couple of weeks now, I bought them in July. The pads are comfy and though they aren't a perfect fit, they snuggle your ears and stay intact after some time, so give them time. Connectivity is dead simple for both Android and iOS, I've paired them with my Wileyfox Swift and i also used them with my pal's iPhone 5s with no issues whatsoever. They Sound is AMAZING. These BLUETOOTH PAIR SOUND AMAZING. Thanks Wirecutter. Ok bye, lemme get back to listening to Macy Gray.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Oeri

customer_reviews.title: Music sound is good but phone calls may have some background buzzing noise
customer_reviews.text: Update: downgrade from 5 to 2 stars. 1) Ear piece got detached from the headband piece after 4 mo of usage. 2) when you get calls, the Calls don’t get routed to the headphones, they get routed to the phone speakers. It’s annoying because it takes 1-2 seconds to reroute the sound to the headphones. ————— The pairing on the phone is easy and it allows multiple devices to be paired to; it's easy to switch between the devices. If you play music it is great sound, but I've realized that phone calls do not have that stability in the sound. When i disable the device and talk on the phone, I have not experienced the buzzing noise.
customer_reviews.author: Buatkokk

customer_reviews.title: Easy multipoint
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use with 2 phones I carry daily. I listen to podcasts and music on one and take and make frequent calls on the other (work). I'm also easily frustrated with tedious or quirky setup. So far I love these. Pairing with both phones was super easy and they worked the first time. I can listen to music and when a work call comes in I just answer it. When the call is over I hang up and my music starts again. Sound quality is good. Doesn't blow your doors off. But it plenty good.
customer_reviews.author: R.Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nailed it
customer_reviews.text: I lost the stupid headphone dongle for my iPhone in about a day, so knew I wanted Bluetooth headphones that worked well, were comfortable, and not to big. Nailed it! I have only had them a little while and mostly use them in the house so can't comment on their durability but dammit, I have to say I think Apple was right. Not having a headphone cord while I'm bopping around cleaning the house is definitely better.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Painful
customer_reviews.text: I have had my eye on these headphones for a long time and was delighted when the price dropped, so I bought them. My ears were so sore after wearing them for approximately an hour. The pads are soft enough but the shape of the pads are round and my ears are oblong. These would be so much better if the pads were oval shaped rather than round. The sound was okay and the noise cancellation was okay but please make the pads bigger or different...these hurt.
customer_reviews.author: K T-berry

customer_reviews.title: Product Life 1 day
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 1 day. I have other Jabra bluetooth devices that have worked flawlessly for year. Not sure why these wont stay connected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yep, these'll do.
customer_reviews.text: Decent set of headphones for the price. Paired with no issues and played even on occasion when the voice would say "no device connected". Sound quality is excellent, there is little or no lag in sound when watching videos or playing games, the microphone is excellent, and the headphones are comfy for long use. The only real complaint is a pretty standard Bluetooth one - occasionally playback pauses momentarily with a "pop" noise, then resumes. I've run into that before, so I am not overly surprised. Not perfect, but I would certainly buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Loux

customer_reviews.title: Jabra Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I use these daily and they sound great and last over 8 hours. Charging does not take long (less than an hour) and I never had an issue with the Bluetooth pairing. I prefer over the ear headphones but these work great for me even though they are on the ear.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Hard to imagine a better value ... for the price, I find these headphones very satisfying ... the sound quality is very good ... the microphone is very good ... easy to connect via Bluetooth ... decent range ... I use these almost daily for music, podcasts and conference calls at work ... I have no complaints ... you can pay a lot more for Bluetooth headphones but the value for the price is hard to beat with these Jabra's ... recommended ...
customer_reviews.author: Rick Langdon

customer_reviews.title: Good value, good sound, poor fit
customer_reviews.text: These would easily be 5 stars at their price for sound, comfort, battery life, and reliability. However, their fit is poor. I can’t lean forward without them falling off my head, and I have a big head, like max size helmets and hats. It’s infuriating because despite trying all sorts of adjustments of the headband, i have to be very aware of the angle of my head when using them or else they fall right onto the ground. I think the issue could be solved by changing the arc of the headband to be a smaller radius but i can’t do this manually. That’s a suggestion for the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Murillo

customer_reviews.title: Connection Issues
customer_reviews.text: I'm not having a good experience with these headphones. They connect quickly but the sound stutters for about 15 seconds before normalizing. This happens on all of my devices, regardless of distance. Recently, the connection has been dropping between my phone (shirt pocket) and headphones while listening, which is enough for me to start looking for another pair. The sound quality was good for Bluetooth on ear headphones and I was surprised at how comfortable they were with glasses (not perfect but better than most). They even stayed on while running which was a great thing. I just can't deal with the connection issues.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great for casual listening, NOT running!
customer_reviews.text: For my purposes and the Cyber Monday deal (50% off $100), these are great. LOVE the Bluetooth/wireless, color is great, no trouble with sound quality or battery life thus far (but I've only had them for about a week). The one problem I've noticed though (which isn't super relevant to me, but thought I should share) is that they fit fairly loosely on my head, so I do NOT think they would work for running/moving, which is weird because they're called Jabra MOVE. Oh well. Might be okay for weightlifting/stationary bike/etc., but they sort of fall off my head if I bend to tie my shoes or something like that.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Great headphone, bad workmanship
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Jabra has honored the warranty and I should receive a replacement pair within 5-7 business days. Really great customer service. I really love these headphones, but unfortunately the stitching on the seams of both headphones are already tearing after only 2 months of usage. Don't get me wrong, the headphones are great, sound quality is great, but there seems to be an issue with the quality of the stitching, because it's already worn out.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Gruber

customer_reviews.title: Fatal Bluetooth Issue
customer_reviews.text: Probably my most disappointing headphone purchase. Even supposedly cheap bluetooth headphones haven't had the same issues. There seems to be a significant bluetooth electrical contact issue, as the left speaker stopped working in bluetooth mode immediately.
customer_reviews.author: sjd

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best $50-75 price point headphones
customer_reviews.text: The sound is fantastic for the price, very good bass and decent balance on the higher notes. The material always feels sleek and made of quality. It isn’t going to be the best material ever but solid for the price. The battery life is good for a trip or any type of travel. I’ll edit this if anything happens within some months.
customer_reviews.author: M R

customer_reviews.title: Not for bluetooth transmitters
customer_reviews.text: I can't use these with my blue tooth transmitter. They can't pair. When you press the "pair" button, an insistent voice say's to "go to the blue tooth menu on the phone and select Jabra from the list. Guess what, I'm not connecting to a phone and have no menu to select from. Otherwise, nice sound, comfortable on the head.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, returned.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they were The Wirecutter's top pick and appeared to be good and were well reviewed by Amazon customers. However I was really let down. In my opinion the pair I got (other than having more, and arguably distorted bass) didn't sound any better than the factory ear buds that came with my iPhone 7. On top of that, the ear cups are tiny and hot, and they felt like they were going to fall off when I bent over. I didn't feel like they were made to last.
customer_reviews.author: GoClick

customer_reviews.title: Extremely mediocre headphones
customer_reviews.text: Comfort: Not so much uncomfortable as just not really comfortable. Battery life: Fine I guess, I have to charge them daily. Sound Quality: Surprisingly fine Connection: Ugh ... they reconnect and start talking through unnecessarily long instructions about how to reconnect all the time. These are a bad deal for the price. If they were half as much, maybe. There are many things that are mediocre about them and a few that are actively bad. They disconnect frequently and begin to talk through a long monologue about reconnecting. This is not at all helpful.
customer_reviews.author: br7tt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome workout headphones with lots of bass
customer_reviews.text: For the price this headphone is a steal. I first connected to my phone but was slightly disappointed by the amount of bass. However, I downloaded an equalizer app and that changed everything. There is so much bass more than the ear can handle. Perfect for working out. No sweat since it is an on-ear headphone. You can turn off the annoying voice commands that come out by holding down the volume down button when switching on the headphone. The amount of tension to keep the headphones on is good enough for running and weight lifting. Battery is good enough for about three 2-hour trips to the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Justin K

customer_reviews.title: Tough to beat, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Tough to find anything wrong with these. They're comfortable, they sound great, they pair quickly, and they aren't expensive. Headphones with comparable sound and build quality typically cost 2-4x more. The only possible negative is that the battery life isn't quite as long as some other models. 8 hours is typically more than enough, but I can see that becoming an issue for a trans-Pacific flight or something similar. Still, for the money you save you could afford multiple battery packs.
customer_reviews.author: C. A.

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones! They sound great, and are really comfortable. They're not noise-canceling, but I've found they're close enough when I use them at work. The battery life is excellent, and I've had no complaints when using the microphone to answer phone calls. I really like how they include a headphone cable, which can be used instead of Bluetooth (though I haven't used it yet). I've tried several different earbuds to use with my iPhone 7 (without a headphone jack), and these are way better. I wish I had bought these first.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Solin

customer_reviews.title: Good sound for price, too tight
customer_reviews.text: Great Bluetooth headphones if you can find them on sale. I found them for $50. They are now $45 if you use Wikibuy, so jump on it! My only complaint is that they aren't that comfortable. I wear glasses, and after about 30 min they were hurting my head. With my glasses off I can stand them for about an hour before having to take them off. They are just a little too tight and hot to wear for extended periods without a rest. The sound quality is good for the price, and the quality of material seems good.
customer_reviews.author: RiddleN

customer_reviews.title: Ok headphones, maybe buy them if they are on sale?
customer_reviews.text: Ok headphones, good sound quality and decent battery life but I have a few complaints: 1) The ear cushion started to fall apart after prolonged use, its a real shame, they are comfortable but now the padding is exposed. 2) They allow you to pair to two devices, this is great but as you lose connection with the secondary device audio cuts in and out, and there is no way to get the headphones to not auto reconnect to the last two devices, this causes some real head aches 3) The low battery warning is insanely stupid how it tells you and basically dies a minute later
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Albanese

customer_reviews.title: child sized
customer_reviews.text: I have small ears and can not wear these headphones because of the pressure on my ears. The holes for the ears are less than 1.5 inches in length and 1.25 in width. The full pads are 3 inches in length and 2.5 inches in width. My ears are red after less than a minute of wear so I can not tell you about the sound quality, but I did notice the noise cancellation is minimal. the expandable band is limited so that my husband can not wear them, the fit is too tight. you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: methinks

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: My favorite thing about these are the comfy ear pads and the weight on them! I use these when I DJ and the wireless battery lasts up to 6 hours after a full charge, which is awesome. The only downside is that the on-ear functionalities are inconsistent depending on what programs are open on your device. Just play around with it before a DJ set so that the buttons don't accidentally pause your music instead of turning up the volume!
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I just got a defective set?
customer_reviews.text: These worked great at first. They were a Christmas gift for my granddaughter who is 12 and she keeps them at my house to use when she is here so they didn’t get used a lot. She told me today that one side has so much static that she just can’t wear them anymore. She said it began this last month but just got worse. Unfortunately it’s too late to exchange them since I don’t see that as an option now. She is disappointed and I wasted money for something that she probably only used less than ten times.
customer_reviews.author: K. Scott

customer_reviews.title: An answer to my need
customer_reviews.text: Because I wear hearing aids, I needed some headphones to boost my hearing in Zoom meetings, especially during discussions where several different people were talking back and forth. I am able to wear these headphones with my hearing aids, and hear so much better. These are comfortable for longer sessions too. Good sound quality too.
customer_reviews.author: Silverado

customer_reviews.title: you get a pretty decent sound
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised. For the money, you get a pretty decent sound. It's not the best but you really will struggle to find a noticeable audio difference with units costing three times as much. I mean for normal people. The audio geeks will always find fault but have you seen the price?
customer_reviews.author: Kyle B.

customer_reviews.title: these were not for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because the price was right. Well, it was wrong for me. First of all they are too tight. I could not wear my glasses while wearing the headphones. The first and second time wearing them the sound was ok and I could not hear any outside noise. The third time I used them was while I was watching tv. The sound started to cut out a lot. I remember others saying that was a problem. I could not figure out a fix so I am returning these and saving up for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Katz

customer_reviews.title: Hated the fit and in turn, hated the sound.
customer_reviews.text: Gave these a couple months as a test run. Found these to fit really poorly. Loose on the head, and tight on the ears which led to a really poor experience both from a comfort standpoint and an acoustical one. For the money there are much better options across the board. Audio was slightly above average at best with rather low volume, again due to the not truly being over the ear headphones. Used only for home, but wouldn't dare try exercise or even outdoor transit as they would fall off doing average things such laundry or vacuuming. Too many choices at this price point (or slightly more for much superior) to give any kind of a recommendation. Hated them.
customer_reviews.author: King_Moonracer

customer_reviews.title: Jabra Has Beats beat
customer_reviews.text: Love them. Best deal around. I have the Jabra Revo wired and they sound great but I wanted some wireless headphones. I have the earbud wireless and they are Ok at they fall out with movement. I tried beats solo 3 and was very disappointed. Returned them a few days later. Next up Jabra Move. These sound great. Way better than beats. They are comfortable but beats 3 solo was a little more comfy for me. But the sound was the deal breaker. Jabra Has beats beat by miles.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon E.

customer_reviews.title: So Sorry I bought these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I was initially quite pleased with these headphones, pairing to Bluetooth worked most the the time and over the ear headphones do provide a bit of ambient noise blocking which is better than nothing. Were these fall short is battery lifetime which has degraded since the time of purchase such that I can not get through a whole workout at the gym without them running out of charge, as I previous owner of Jabra products, I had a higher expectation.
customer_reviews.author: Banie

customer_reviews.title: Two very happy teens
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two pairs of these for my teens and they absolutely love them. Both say they are very comfortable, battery life is great and sound is good. They both like the understated and compact design, preferring the look of these to some of the more popular, bulky headphones out there. They seem well made too. These were an excellent gift and I am seriously considering a third pair for myself. I think the only improvement would be the ability to fold them, although I would not want to trade durability for that.
customer_reviews.author: Quahog

customer_reviews.title: Great value and excellent battery life, can be a little uncomfortable during extended wear
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is very good. Battery life is impressive, and I've used this to listen all-day, as many as five days in a row without having to recharge. Padded circles around the headphones are a little small and can get uncomfortable after extended wear. This seems to improve the more you use them and they loosen up.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Orr

customer_reviews.title: and worst of all
customer_reviews.text: I've had two pairs of these. The first performed well, but the ear cups began to split after not too long, exposing large portions of bare foam. The second pair are stitched rather than sealed, so I do not expect the same issue to recur, but their Bluetooth connectivity has been finicky from the start. I had assumed it was my laptop's fault, but on an entirely different machine they show the same suite of symptoms--repeated disconnects, failure to connect, and worst of all, other bluetooth devices (including my trackpad) would begin to stutter for a minute or two after pairing these headphones. I just hope I didn't wait too long to seek a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What happened?
customer_reviews.text: What happened? I had a pair of these for about a year and never once had a connection issue. I took the recommendation from wire utter and was very happy with them. Unfortunately I stepped on the. And broke them. I order a replacement pair immediately since I was so happy with them. First pair arrives, terrible connection issues begin. Saying it is connected when it isn’t. Connecting but super low volume. Etc. Send those back order another pair, hoping I just got a dud. Second pair arrived today and is already doing the same things. So disappointed. These were great, now they are terrible. What happened?
customer_reviews.author: michael mchugh

customer_reviews.title: These headphones have changed my life...
customer_reviews.text: I've never been fussy about headphones, but when a friend recommended these to me and I tried them, I couldn't believe the difference. Excellent sound and noise blocking. They are also really comfy on ears with a lot of piercings. I've been re-listening to a lot of my favorite albums and it feels like hearing them over again for the first time!
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: less than perfect for big heads
customer_reviews.text: they sound good and are the first pair of bluetooth headphones I've bought that connected flawlessly to my phone (galaxy s8, and I've only had cheap wireless headphones before). My only issue is that I have a big head, and while they extend enough to cover my ears, they don't hold on very tightly. I have to kind of balance the headband on top of my head- can't lean too far forward or they'll start falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Carlozzi

customer_reviews.title: It hurts your ears after 10 minutes since you worn it
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy to buy this headphones but now it really hurts my ears after just 10 mins of wearing this. Its very uncomfortable and I was having some pain in my ears too. Really disappointed. Please dont buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on Mac/PC?  Wtf?
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly, if you read the fine print Jabara says that these headphones don't work on laptops/desktops/macs/pcs. Since Bluetooth audio is a standard that's generally the same no matter the device, you know something must be pretty janky in the product if they don't support a whole class of machines. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Bobby McBobFace

customer_reviews.title: Good sound
customer_reviews.text: These work well although at first they seemed a bit finicky about pairing. But now pairing is immediate. Sound from TV is clear. I wear behind the ear hearing aids so I need a large cushioned earphone. These are not as large as I would like so they don't seal as well and are a little less comfortable that other earphones I own. However, I have listened to two hour movies and streamed media without feeling uncomfortable, so it can't be too bad.
customer_reviews.author: pnc

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these earphones to listen to media on my smartphone and tablet. After 20 months use the padding cover is disintegrating, and I need to buy a new set of Bluetooth headphones. Even though they still function I need to replace them. I'll never buy anything from Jabra again. Also, these headphones have an irritating stutter when first connecting that the replacement headphones don't have.
customer_reviews.author: bobp

customer_reviews.title: was super easy. My bluetooth dongle (sold separately) picked it ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - setup: was super easy. My bluetooth dongle (sold separately) picked it up without hesitation and it paired within seconds - great sound: I'm no audiophile, just wanted some decent headphones for listening to music and computer vids at work; meets/exceeds expectations - size: easily adjusts to my largish male head - charging: came with micro-usb charging cord - flexibility: came with wired headphone jack cord for use with non-bluetooth devices Cons: - I find the pleather pads, which sit on the ears, a little warm after a short while.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Becker

customer_reviews.title: Sleepless and Watching TV...Yay!
customer_reviews.text: Love my Jabra Move Wireless headphones. They function precisely as advertised...with the exception that...I misunderstood that I'd be able to use them to watch TV while my husband is sleeping with the headphones...alone. I actually requires an adaptor/transmitter. So I then bought the TaoTronics 4.0 Bluetooth Transmitter. Now I can watch TV, Movies and Listen to music while the hubby is asleep at night...and not disturb him! Except of course...when I laugh out loud (she says cringeing)! Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: G-ma Goose

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money! I have been through my fair share of headphones from Beats to the skullcandy (wired, and Bluetooth) and these are probably the best I've had for the money. I love rap music while working out and they sound pretty good, Not a lot of bass but good enough, especially for the price. I've worn them to work out for the last 2 years and have held up pretty nicely for taking such a beating. No swear damage, but the ear piece is getting worn/torn. I would def recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple and elegant Scandinavian inspired headphones that work better than the price.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful scandinavian design. I was looking for a wireless on-ear bluetooth headphone for work and wanted to avoid the over the ear designs that make you seem unapproachable at your desk. These have a much slimmer profile and are just beautiful. Quality is there for a $59.99 headphone. I was surprised at how much sound these blocked, which was more than I desired, but have grown to love. I wish the included 1.5mm wire would have had a mic so these could have been used as a headset, but overall, I would buy these again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: The Neylan’s

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality good, phone calls also
customer_reviews.text: These fit me quite well, as I have a somewhat small head and most headphones are too large. In the cold winter they function as earwarmers for outdoor walks, a real plus (no need for a hat)! Sound quality good, phone calls also. I walked an hour today and thought they were very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: aperture

customer_reviews.title: Extremely uncomfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: I cannot wear these headphones for more than 25 minutes at a time without having to take them off. They are tight around my head, and the ear pads really hurt my ears. I could wear my previous over ear audio technicas for 12 hours on end without a problem. I bought based on Wirecutter's recommendation that the Move was a great combination of comfort, sound quality and price. I agree the price and sound quality is good, but I wish I could return these and get a pair of over ear headphones, because they are basically worthless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Bloomberg

customer_reviews.title: Good price OK headphones
customer_reviews.text: These we're OK headphones , I am use to beats solo 2 with a cord and they sound much better in everyway . I purchased two pairs of these and returned one the other my girlfriend will use at the gym. They are light weight comfortable with good battery life and decent sound. If you factor in the low price it is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Doug White

customer_reviews.title: Lowest volume setting isn't low enough
customer_reviews.text: I use these headphones to listen to music while I work. The lowest volume setting isn't low enough. It's too loud for me. That makes it hard to listen to music in the background. I would prefer it if they could be much quieter with the same number of volume levels.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones so far. They seem like they'll last a long time. The only issues I have are: 1. It takes a while for audio to connect. The headphones themselves connect immediately but audio will continue to play on my phone for a good 20 seconds sometimes. 2. Connecting to multiple devices doesn't seem to work very well. As far as I can tell - you can't actually use them at the same time or select which you want to listen to.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: You hold your phone in your hand at all times? These are the headphones for you.
customer_reviews.text: They're fairly comfortable and easy to use, and the sound quality is decent. But when I connect these to my phone, the audio stutters a lot if I have my phone in my pocket. So much so that it's too frustrating to use. I would not recommend these to someone for regular on-the-go use. I am planning to donate these to a friend to use in his house for late night TV watching, where there's no dastardly denim between the headphones and the audio source to muck things up.
customer_reviews.author: Zan

customer_reviews.title: work great, sound great, "manual" leaves a little to be desired
customer_reviews.text: These headphones paired effortlessly with my Pixel 2 XL, and have connected quickly without a problem since then. While they might not be audiophile quality, they have a reasonable bass and sound quite balanced. I'm not a heavy listener, using these about and hour a day, and they seem to easily live up to the rated battery play time. The one minor complaint I have is that nowhere is it documented what the status lights mean when one is charging the headphones - turns out that it's a steady red while charging, and changes to green when fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Osmund

customer_reviews.title: Believe the hype, they sound great for the price and run small.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for the price. I read the reviews and noted several that said they run small. For me that is advantageous because I have a reasonably small head for an adult. Believe the reviews. They aren't *too* tight on me but they are tight.
customer_reviews.author: Jonman

customer_reviews.title: They're comfortable, not too bulky
customer_reviews.text: I charge them periodically, but they seem to never run out of battery! They're comfortable, not too bulky, and they block out a fair amount of sound despite not having active noise cancelling. I'm also very impressed with the sound quality - sounds like a $200 headphone set.
customer_reviews.author: Thompson H.

customer_reviews.title: These are on-ear headphones but they are great
customer_reviews.text: They have an audio input, comes with audio cable, and that works with no battery or anything, so that's great because one day the battery will of course die. In the mean time, these are great Bluetooth headphones. I didn't realize they are on-ear which I usually hate, but these are pretty comfortable. I have a small head and they fit me fine, if you have a big head you'll probably find they're a little small.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth drops constantly
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are reasonably comfortable, and my sound quality is fine, but after about a year of use, they won't consistently stay connected to my bluetooth. They connect, then drop randomly every few minutes so that I have to turn them off and on or go to my computer's bluetooth menu to fiddle with the settings. This makes them useless because I lose so much time to resetting them, whether I'm using them to transcribe data for my thesis, or listening to a show while cleaning my house. If the manufacturers have any ideas, I'm open to hearing them, but I wouldn't advise this purchase without a clear troubleshoot
customer_reviews.author: Alex Mercado

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound & Value For The Money!
customer_reviews.text: I just got these a couple of days ago and have to say how pleasantly surprised I am at the sound quality. It sounds like it costs much more than what it is selling for. Very even frequency response. No problem pairing with my Note 5, Pixel C and Fire HD 8. I'm wearing them now as I write this, going on my third hour wearing them (with glasses) and they are still comfortable. If you're on the fence about getting a pair do yourself a favor and get them,you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Not completely satisfied with the Bluetooth connection
customer_reviews.text: The headset has a slim profile, which is what I was looking for but I am not truly satisfied. The soft, fabric headband is nice but it absorbs the oils from hair, now I don’t know how to clean that off. The Bluetooth connection skips a lot. Especially when I connect to my iPad and stream video and/or music. The battery does not last as long as I would like. The price is good but I wanted a better Bluetooth connection.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% noise cancelling, let in the perfect amount of ambient sound
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me, you think true noise-canceling headphones (like Bose) add pressure to your inner ear and are overall uncomfortable. These are perfect for long commutes in NYC or traveling. I liked that I could still hear when train announcements were happening, but busy conversations and annoying sounds were still blocked out.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey Fite

customer_reviews.title: Great On-Ear wireless headphones
customer_reviews.text: Saw the brand and price and bought it. When I received them, I thought about returning them because I didn't realize they were on-ear... not over-the-ear. Decided to try them and was not as disappointed as I thought I would be. Comfortable, light weight, easy pairing, great sound. Keeping... but will continue looking for over-the- ear wireless headphones.
customer_reviews.author: W. Wong

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty, but it's like stilettos for your ears.
customer_reviews.text: I like the aesthetic of the headphones. The product feels solid. The cups sit on the ear and the sound is pretty clear. I like the controls, easy to use and understand. However, it's not comfortable. After an hour of use, my ears hurt. Its worst when. I wear my glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K.

customer_reviews.title: Great for work and gym
customer_reviews.text: Great value for wireless headphones at the office or gym, and that aren't so expensive you are worried about throwing them into your bag. Do the job well enough to listen to shows and play background music. Comfy over the ears. Good quality for price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far, so great!
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using these headphones for a week, but they're great. Right off the bat, they're smaller than you think. But that actually turns out ok because they store better. The adjustable band works fine and they cover my ears with no problems. The small size means they're light too. Sound quality is perfectly fine. Bass is deep, highs are clear. I can't say how long battery life is just yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Fry

customer_reviews.title: good sound and volume, battery life should be longer
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy them but it seems like the battery life is too short. That's only the case if you use them on an all-day basis like I do. Also to turn off the annoying voice prompts, as soon as you turn on the headphones press and hold the volume up (or down) button (almost simultaneously) a voice will tell you when it turns off.
customer_reviews.author: ldrewguy

customer_reviews.title: not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: When I bought these I thought they would be "over the ear". But instead they are more "on the hear". I though the sound was great but after wearing them for more than about an hour, my ears started to hurt. To me, "over the ear" means your ear is surrounded and nothing is actually pressing on your ear. I found a different pair of speakers that meet my needs and I can wear them for hours without any discomfort at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Finmand

customer_reviews.title: Waaay too tight!
customer_reviews.text: Big mistake! Recommended by Wirecutter. I can only bear to wear it for a few minutes. Probably good for children or small-headed people. I never even bothered to pair it, as I knew I'd never wear it anyway. Hoping it might have a metal band, I tried to gently stretch it out a little, and something quickly popped. Oops! So much for gently. Or returning it.
customer_reviews.author: GeoMac

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, tight fit, problem with left speaker in Bluetooth mode
customer_reviews.text: Sounds is good. Fit is not great, it clamps onto the ears tightly and there is no way to adjust for a looser fit. Also, about 5 months later (with very infrequent use due to the uncomfortable fit), I used it with the 3.5mm aux line-in connection for the first time, and since then I have not been getting sound in the left speaker when in Bluetooth mode (strangely, both speakers still work fine when in line-in mode).
customer_reviews.author: TEOH SHAO THING

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: If you are an audio-phile or sound snob, STOP READING THIS! (you probably wouldn't even purchase these anyway) Now, if you're someone who wants some good wireless phones without dropping $100-$500 then you're like me and you'll be happy! great sound AND bass. Range is good too. No real complaints. If you want deep sound details about this product, then these are not for you. You're getting blue tooth tech and good sound for under a $100, nuff said. The product registration is wonky, they'll ask for your email but no product serial number or receipt then send you spam. I'd skip it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave O

customer_reviews.title: Save Yourself Some Money Buy Other Headphones
customer_reviews.text: One of the sides of the headphones stopped working within 2 weeks of owning it and with less than 5 days worth of real use. I would have returned this had I not had them stolen! If you tend to have a bigger sized head or an average head for a 6+ foot person, I would recommend you invest in bigger earphones. They barely reached my ears in size.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but has some Bluetooth issues.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good pair of headphones for the price. They sound pretty good overall if you set them up properly. What I mean by that is that I have to connect them every time I want to use them as a new pair of Bluetooth headphones by forgetting the device and then pairing them once again. If I don’t do that they will have short sound interference every so often, can’t really tell what makes it happen. A bit on the tight side also, they are not very comfortable for long periods as they sit on top of the ear.
customer_reviews.author: Wjmarrero

customer_reviews.title: So-So fit
customer_reviews.text: Im not an audiophilia person, I just wanted something that sounds and looks good, and fits well on my head. Check marks for sounds and looks, but the fit isn't the best. I would say I have a normal sized head, and these feel comfortable, but it fits too loose. I was hoping I could use this at the gym, but if I look down, the headphones will start slipping off. Pretty annoying. Other than that, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Competes with best
customer_reviews.text: The Jabra Move Bluetooth headset will take you by surprise, no one expects this kind of fidelity at these price points. The sound quality of these cans is up there with the Bose, Sony, Sennheiser etc no jokes, yet it doesn't carry the price tags of the incumbents. The acoustic noise canceling also does a pretty decent job. Built with high-quality materials, lightweight and fit snug to even jog with, superior battery life and overall great looks. I love them, bought my girlfriend her pair so she can keep off mine. Amazon, as always, delivered them before ETA and that was a cherry on top.
customer_reviews.author: Nobby Mabale

customer_reviews.title: Good sound for one device
customer_reviews.text: Good sound. I use them when I mow. They suck outside for phone calls. Whatever you do, do NOT pair them to more than one thing. Every thirty seconds you will get notified that they are paired to two devices. Incessantly.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Busteed

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones  of the year !
customer_reviews.text: It is the latest in sound technology. Popular in Europe. Light weight. Charges quickly and stays charged forever it seems. I have given three as gifts now! It beats “Beats” headphones hands down and much better then their heavy more expensive headphones the this same company makes. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Minna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Headphones for the Price.
customer_reviews.text: I love the wireless feature of these headphones. The absence of an attached cord is liberating as I can move about freely while listening to music without worrying about dropping or otherwise messing up my cell phone. The sound quality is fine as far as I am concerned, but then I am not an audiophile. They might feel differently, but I am completely satisfied with the sound of the music I hear coming through these headphones. The battery lasts a long time too, and is easily charged using the supplied USB charging cord.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T. Bogumill

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but finicky
customer_reviews.text: Both of my Jabra headphones (Jabra Elite and Jabra Move) are solid purchases for the money. However, they often have connectivity issues. They want to switch between multiple devices that I have paired before. I sometimes have to clear out the past devices to keep it dedicated to the device I'm listening to. It is a hassle, but again the price is hard to beat. I'm not an audiophile, but they sound good to me.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Adamczak

customer_reviews.title: and overall am very pleased. It sometimes is a bit static-y the first ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this almost daily at the gym, and overall am very pleased. It sometimes is a bit static-y the first 30 seconds it is connected to my phone/Spotify account, but then is totally fine. It did this with my old Pixel and now my Motorola, so I'm pretty certain it's not the phone, and it doesn't do it with my other Bluetooth headphones, so feel confident it's the Jabra. The music quality is pretty good, I wouldn't say amazing, but very good.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Adequate for basic headphones
customer_reviews.text: Bought as primary headset after having to switch to telehealth as a mental health therapist. They sound average, which is not a. Big deal for me. Cons: microphone is crappy: my clients say it cuts in and out and is difficult to hear me. The adjustable head band also loosens while it sits on my head. I have to readjust it constantly for it to fit my small head
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price! Little uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: They have decent sound. Better than you'd expect from a sixty dollar pair of headphones. They pair easily and they're sharp looking. However, they were uncomfortable sitting on my ears for anything more than ten or fifteen minutes. :-( Someone else may have a better pain tolerance, or different shaped head. They're worth a try for the money, but I went another direction with the taotronics line... which came with ANC.
customer_reviews.author: DJKTenX

customer_reviews.title: Good while they lasted
customer_reviews.text: These were great headphones for commuting while they worked - I actually like that they’re not noise-cancelling so I can hear what’s going on around me, and they’re compact enough compared to other over/on ear headphones to keep in my backpack or purse. But about 6mo in the Bluetooth got very choppy - it began taking several tries to connect, then it would randomly drop, and if I did get them to connect the sound would skip. I reached out to product support, we’ll see if they offer any solutions!
customer_reviews.author: margot y

customer_reviews.title: Great for price, cancels noise great
customer_reviews.text: I have had these now for almost 5 months. I am very impressed. Volume is great, work with the Bluetooth great. I use a very loud machine and I can hardly hear it with these on. I will say they are a little small however, would be nice if they made them a little bit larger. But hey, when you pay 50$ for a pair of wireless headphones, its a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Sharkbees007

product_meta.title: Jabra Move Wireless Stereo Headphones - Black
product_meta.description: Style:Move (Original)| Color:BlackEngineered by some of the world’s leading sound experts, the Jabra MOVE Wireless Stereo Headphones provides unrivalled sound quality in the wireless category. Our signature DSP delivers a crisp digital sound that is bound to bring out the true depth and clarity of the music you love. We developed the clean, simple, Scandinavian design to encompass a powerhouse of sound and functionality. MOVE Wireless is easy to connect and allows you to leave your phone in your pocket and easily control your music and phone calls from your headphones. This is life on the move the easy way.
feature_bullets: Listen to your tunes and never miss a call
Ultra lightweight and adjustable headband fits all head types
Durable stainless steel headband and dirt resistant fabric for life on the move, 40 millimeter Dynamic Drivers
Connects to all Bluetooth ready devices , phones, computers, tablets and more; includes optional cord so you can use your headphones on flights; Easy pairing
Up to 8 hours talk time/music time and up to 12 days standby time.Stream Two Devices with Multi use ; Bluetooth 4.0 Wireless Connectivity

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars2,247 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #257 in On-Ear Headphones#289 in Over-Ear Headphones
